intro: Melochia colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian melochia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display. Melochia colombiana prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for warm, humid climates.
